noteR.para: Before carrying out any operation on a vehicle fitted with the Stop & Start system, always follow the safety instructions vehicle : precautions for the repairGIEMR-002446

To avoid all risk of damage to the systems, apply the safety and cleanliness instructions and operation recommendations before carrying out any repairairbag and pretensioners : precautions for the repairGIEMR-000004.

reusenote.dyndoctitle: To avoid any risk of injury, always wear personal protection (gloves, goggles and a face mask to protect the airways).
reusenote.para: To avoid any risk of injury, always wear personal protection (gloves, goggles and a face mask to protect the airways).

noteR.para: To eliminate the risk of any accident, do not reuse pyrotechnic components.
It is essential to destroy pretensioners or airbags before scrapping a vehicle or a part only.

ul.li: Each part is intended for a specific vehicle type and should not be fitted on another vehicle under any circumstances. The parts are not interchangeable.

Do not trigger pretensioners which are to be returned under warranty because of a faulty stalk. This makes analysis of the part by the supplier impossible. Return the defective part to Techline in the packaging of the new part.

noteR.para: To prevent any risk of an accident when a pyrotechnic component is triggered, check that no-one is in the vicinity.
If triggering is not possible (faulty ignition module) return the part to Techline.
The destruction tool is only connected to the battery once all of the preparation steps have been completed.

procstep.para: You must use theTool for destroying airbags and pretensioners.Ele.1287 destruction tool and one of the three adapter kits Kit of 2 adapters for the airbag and pretensioner destruction tool.Ele.1287-02, Adapter for airbag and pretensioner destruction toolEle.1908 or Kit of 2 adapters for the airbag and pretensioner destruction tool.Ele.1812, depending on the type of airbag connector to be destroyed.
Use a 12 V battery to power the destruction tool Tool for destroying airbags and pretensioners.Ele.1287

noteR.para: The airbags to be destroyed must be removed.
The airbags must be triggered outside the workshop, in an area with sufficient space.
If the airbag has two levels of activation (i.e. it is fitted with two connectors), destroy both connectors.

procstep.para: Prepare the adapter corresponding to the airbag to be triggered.

ul.li: the adapter to the destruction toolTool for destroying airbags and pretensioners.Ele.1287,

procstep.para: Put the airbag on two wooden blocks.
Triggering is carried out in a stack of old tyres.
Make sure that the airbag deployment will not be hindered.

Unwind the full length of the destruction tool Tool for destroying airbags and pretensioners.Ele.1287 in order to stay as far away as possible from the pyrotechnic component to be triggered (approximately 10 metres).
Connect the two feed wires of the destruction tool Tool for destroying airbags and pretensioners.Ele.1287 to the 12 V battery.
Trigger the airbag by pressing the two push buttons on the tool simultaneously.

procedure.title: Triggering a pyrotechnic component fitted on a vehicle that is destined to be scrapped:

procstep.para: Move the vehicle outside the workshop.
Select the adapter corresponding to the pyrotechnic component to be triggered.

ul.li: the destruction tool Tool for destroying airbags and pretensioners.Ele.1287 on the adapter,
the adapter to the pyrotechnic component.

procstep.para: Unwind the full length of the destruction tool Tool for destroying airbags and pretensioners.Ele.1287 in order to stay as far away as possible from the pyrotechnic component to be triggered (approximately 10 metres).
Connect the two feed wires of the destruction tool Tool for destroying airbags and pretensioners.Ele.1287 to the 12 V battery.
Trigger the pyrotechnic component by pressing the two push buttons on the tool simultaneously.

procedure.title: Destruction of part removed from the vehicle:

procstep.para: Proceed in the same way as for an airbag (in a stack of old tyres).
